name: Lapsang Sousong- An Old Time Smoky Black
description:
This is classic old time favorite for many western tea drinkers. Small leaf type of black from Fujian became very popular in China, especially the smoked tea from Wuyi Mountain.  This light body with slight smokiness tastes the best with a dash milk.  A great morning treat with your toast and jam.

Instructions:
1tsp/6oz/1.5min/2 infusions/190F

2.4oz $15

name: Ali Mountain Black/A Beautifully Made Hybrid from Highland
description:
My long time Oolong supplier, Mr. Chung has extended his skill into white and black tea.  This crop was made with the oolong tea plant from Ali Mountain, Taiwan, where he has cultivated and trained his team for more 25 years of making his Big Leaf,  Pao Chung and High Mountain Oolong. 
This black tea's aroma echoes the floral of his Pao Chung. It is something new and very unique for oolong and black tea drinkers to try.  

Instructions:
2 tsp/5oz/195/3 infusions
$18/0.75oz

name: Black Phoenix-One Should Never Buy Peach Flavored Tea
description:
The natural fruit and floral notes from this beautiful black tea will trigger your senses instantly.  
Region: Guantong, China

Instructions: 1tbs/6oz water/30 sec/5 or more infusions
1.5oz Box

name: Ruby Black - A Tea To Wake Up For
description:
A hearty and tasty black tea made from the Taiwan oolong tea bush.  The body of the tea is structured like a good cup of Assam, yet the fragrance of oolong intertwines with a tone of honeysuckle.  It makes rich and characteristic brew. 

$18/box
1.3oz

name: Charcoal Roasted Old Tree Water Sprite-An Old Man Tea ( Wuyi Rock Style)
description:
This is not a tea just made for the old men. This wuyi style rock tea is mild, nutty and long lasting. The retired old men could gather and drink all day long in the tea house.   I enjoy drinking this "old man" style tea so much especially when I have a toasted roast beef sandwich with pepper jack cheese for lunch at the studio.  Surprisingly, the well balanced charcoal roasted Water Sprite pairs with cheese and multi-grain bread very well.  The nuttiness from the roasting process complements the dairy in a refreshing way that you would not find it in wine paring.  Try it out with your grilled sandwiches or just a bowl of nuts. Absolute heavenly!

Instructions:
2tsp/5oz/boiling water/50sec/multiple infusions

1.2oz/$18

name: Green Goddess-Wild Lily Tea Room Staff Favorite (box)
description:
The charcoal roasted Tie Quan Yin/Iron Goddess is a perfect example of a Yao Yang Family tradition since 1875.  The steady and buttery taste comes from long hour of roasting process.   It is a mild, well round and satisfying cup.
It was a staff favorite at Wild Lily Tea Room.

Instructions: 1.5tsp/5oz/195F/1min/5infusions

2.5oz Box 18 dollars

name: Green Goddess -Wild Lily Tea Room Staff Favorite
description:
The charcoal roasted Tie Quan Yin/Iron Goddess is a perfect example of a Yao Yang Family tradition since 1875.  The steady and buttery taste comes from long hour of roasting process.   It is a mild, well round and satisfying cup.

 It was a staff favorite at Wild Lily Tea Room.

$40/5.3oz pack

name: #1 2009 Vintage-Laojizi Old Tree Pu-er
description:
This is the year I lived in Beijing and Mr. Chung sent me 7 cakes of pu-er.  It took me a long time to be familiar with pu-er.  One day I was interviewed about tea and my art work by this Journalist for a magazine.  She had a sip, then she said," Is this pu-er? It is so sweet! Since that day, I got it.  I understood how precious Mr. Chung's pu-er is and so different from everything you find on the market.  By this time, old tree new pu-er became more popular than ever.  
Now this tea is more than 3 years old.  The body of tea has gotten a bit bigger, sweeter and well round taste. And the journalist, Joy became a good friend of mine. Good tea brought precious things to life!

Instructions:
1/2 tsp/4oz boiling water/30 sec/8 infusions
50/2oz

name: #1 2012 Pu-er-Laojizi Old Tree Pu-er
description:
Mr. Chung has been produced Pu-er tea from an old tree since 2004 and was one of the pioneer to use 100% large leave Old Tea Tree harvested before QingMing(early spring harvest).  He has the knowledge to pick the best tea garden on YiWu Mountain, which is the best pu-er tea tree from.  With his masterful skill and the same care as his oolong, his pu-er has been awarded every year since 2006.  These are wonderful to drink now and collectable items to age.

Instructions:
1/2 tsp/4oz boiling Water/30sec/8infusions

$40/2oz

name: Purple Pu-er/A Long Lasting Warming Tea (Box)
description:
This newly invented Pu-er has its special effects on lowering the blood sugar.  It is also a well known Chinese homeopathic tonic for digestion.   It is well rounded, neutral and last forever.  Prepare yourself in a big mug by the fire or at the office.  It gives just enough kind of pick up The flavor won't change after each infusions and it makes 8 infusions.  

Instructions: 1 tbs/6oz/Boiling Water/20 sec/8 infusions
 0.8 oz Box $15

name: Purple Pu-er/A Long Lasting Warming Tea
description:
This newly invented Pu-er has its special effects on lowering the blood sugar.  It is also a well known Chinese homeopathic tonic for digestion.   It is well rounded, neutral and last forever.  Prepare yourself in a big mug by the fire or at the office.  It gives just enough kind of pick up The flavor won't change after each infusions and it makes 8 infusions.  

Instructions: 1 tbs/6oz/Boiling Water/20 sec/8 infusions
100 gram bag

name: Big Leaf-A Minimalist's Wonder
description:
The Big Leaf comes top on my favorite tea list because the minimal way of making this tea yet brings out the most from the tea leaves and the nature.  It is masterfully done in the way that allowing the nature plays the part to intensify the flavor rather the manipulations by the tea makers.  The tea artisan has a wise mind and deep knowledge in tea to let the process unfold itself.  There is no master's ego in this tea, instead I taste the air, mineral, greenness and openness on the high mountain.  
You may try varies of temperature(180-195) to make this tea. It will display different demotion on your palette. 
1tbs/6oz/190F/1min  Multiple Infusions
0.7oz packed in two boxes
Instructions for Iced tea:
2 Table Spoon/24oz spring Water/Leave in fridge over night

name: HIgh Mountain Paochung Oolong-A Unique Floral Scent Companied With Complexity And Surprises
description:
2013 Spring crop.  Every infusion comes as a surprise with it multi dimensional taste.  

1 oz 

Instructions: 5oz/190F/50sec/multiple infusions.

name: High Mountain Oolong-A good everyday detox remedy
description:
In the very hot and dry Beijing summer, the heat was vicious.  I drank this cold brewed oolong to force all of the heat out of my body.  Chinese generally don’t like air conditioning.  Lots of taxi drivers wouldn’t turn it on to save money. When I would ask, the taxi driver would say,” Sweating is good!’  He was right though.  

There are many ways to cool your system down, like drinking cold brew oolong and Yu Ya green tea.  These two are very green and yin type of tea, which give a good supply of vitamin C and antioxidants.  The yin harmonizes the heated body.  You also can make this tea in a dry heated apartment in the wintertime to neutralize your system. 

Cold Brew:1 tsp/one 12 oz bottle spring water/fridge over night
Hot Brew: 1tsp/6oz/195F/1.5 min/multiple Infusions
3oz Box

name: Pingling White Tea-The Tea Takes You To A Pure Land
description:
This tea is soft like a cloud
Don't even think about grabbing it, because it is not there
The only thing you can do is totally relax, open your five senses (not an easy thing)
Tea comes to you whole
Takes you to a pure land

This precious white is carefully hand picked tender leaves from three types of tea plants, and a new experiment from Mr. Chung, a master tea artisan, who makes our Big Leaf and Paochung.  His greatest skill on  how not to over process the tea and let out what the nature could offer at its best.  He said," This tea takes a great spring day to make it!"  It takes more than a high quality tea plants to make a good tea. 
Minimum human touch and slow sun-drying makes this soft and delicate white.  It seems to be transparent yet opaque, refreshing yet aromatic.  It is a subtle dance with your five senses. 

0.5 ozBox
Instructions:
185F/1.5 to 2min/1tbs/3 Infusions

name: 1998 Vintage White Brick Tea-Smooth Your Rocky Day
description:
The aged white carries a mild taste of orange peels and very low in caffeine.  This is the tea you could drink all day long and smooth your mood through a rocky day. Two tea spoons of this white, it goes many infusions.

Instructions:
2tsp/5oz gonfu tea pot/boiling water/20 sec/multiple infusions
315gram a cake

name: Yu Ya Green-A Delicate And Sweet Green Tea From A Tea Family Farm
description:
This top leaf green, which you could detect the silver covering on the budding leaves is very well made top quality tea.  Dragon Well is the king the green in China from the Zhejiang Provence by the West Lake region.  However, there are many rolling hills in Zhejiang shares the similar climate or better to cultivate top quality tea, which is not well known even for Chinese domestic market.  This very reasonably priced green is for those picky green tea lovers consume on daily bases.  Good green tea shares a common quality is the sweetness undertone.  The sweetness in Yuya is not hidden as an undertone and it does not have spinachy quality in Japanese Green or pan fried taste in some Chinese Green.  The pure sweetness is out there for you to savor.

Instructions:
Best to make in glass and drink from the glass until 1/3 left then fill the glass. Repeat the process until the taste fades

1.7 oz Box/$18

name: Jasmine Peony-Blossom In Action
description:
The Jasmine blossoming in such a gentle motion and the genuine scent gradually embrace you, making this Jasmine is an act of meditative art itself.  

5 blossoms/40g/a jar 

Instructions:1blossom/ 18oz/185F then watch the blossom

name: Osmanthus Oolong Tea
description:
Throughout September, the town Hangzhou is filled with the scent of the Osmanthus flower, where I spent time to learning brush painting.  Imagine that riding a bike around by the West Lake, the scent followed you everywhere.   
The scent of Osmanthus reveals the romantic life style of Jiang Nan, the region of south of Yanzi River and has inspired artists for centuries.

15tea bags of full leaf oolong/45g
Instructions: Leave one bag in 24oz drinking water overnight in the fridge.

name: Chinese Chrysanthemum & Japanese Honeysuckle-AnHerbal Infusion For Cooling Inner System
description:
This is a common Chinese homeopathic concept to balance our inner yin and yan. Our body gets over heated in the summer heat; more importantly, the inner system gets unbalanced between Yin and Yan.  These four cooling herbals- Japanese honeysuckle, pot marigold, Zhejian wild chrysanthemum and kuting provide efficient shots of Yin to balance your over heated Yan elements.  This infusion is also good for hangover.
Box:10 of 2 gram bag
Instructions:
One Tea bag/36oz boiling water/3 to 5 min

name: Pu-er $ Osmanthus Flower/A Blended Tonic For Digestion
description:
This is not an herbal tea but it contains very low caffeinated Pu-er tea mixes with Osmanthus flowers and hawthorn.  Tibetan uses Pu-er to balance their mean and dairy diet, so Pu-er is known for cutting down grease in food and cholesterol but not for its flavor. The flavor gets so much more friendly when Osmanthus flower and crabapple adding to it.  It is harmless and help to digest the meal after dinner for a at home dinner party.

Instruction: It can make a big pot of tea. 24oz/Boiling Water. If you drink alone in the tea mug, please remember to take the tea out less than a min.

10 of 2 gram bag

name: Gaiwan
description:
A porcelain Gaiwan is a necessity for a serious tea drinker.  It is easy to cup all kinds of tea.  
5oz

name: Porcelain One In One Tea Cup For Urban Tea Snobs
description:
When everyone is drinking away with all kinds of tea bags, a tea snob like you no longer need to suffer with the quality issue.  This cup will serve you the best cup tea at your office while working on computer, talking on the phone or even bringing to your meeting.  It stands out from all the paper cups and ugly mugs.  It is easy and a clean shot to make all kinds of high end loose tea with enclosed infuser.  All components are made of porcelain which maintains heat well and easy to clean.  

8oz capacity

name: No. 20- Variations On Brooklyn Botanical Garden Series 4
description:
The Blossom Series began in 2006.  Since then it has become a life long pursuit that continually moves me--how in every delicate petal is a view into the universe. It is not just the beauty of flowers I am trying to capture; it is a complexity of color, unpretentious form and the alluring atmosphere vibrating in the air of pure natural growth. That mysterious strength, with uplifting joy and hope.

Blossom No. 20- Variations On Brooklyn Botanical Garden Series 4
Oil On Paper (Arches Oil Painting Paper 140lb)
22”x30”

name: No.10 Central Park Cherry Blossom
description:
Blossom No. 10-Cherry Blossom At Central Park 
I have undertaken numerous trips to paint at beloved Central Park since the first year of learning how to paint.  In a way, Central Park taught me how to paint. I had painted cats, mountains, and one Audrey Hepburn portrait in the first three months of enrolling at art school.  Not until the instructor brought us to Central Park in spring 1996 did I finally get my first taste of art and creativity.

There is one spot near the Boat House which has the most gestural old cherry trees, and most of my cherry blossom work comes from that spot. One tree blends into three trees, the gentle blossoms, the prime blossom.... I often think this will be my last Cherry Blossom, then the year after I get inspired again.  Whenever the spring comes, the cherry blossom is so beautiful that I can't let it go without conversing with it on canvas.  
Blossom No. 10-Cherry Blossom At Central Park 
Oil On Linen  2013
55”x90"

name: No.12 Brooklyn Botanical Garden Series 2
description:
My first monumental work after settling in Brooklyn as an urban painter was inspired by the nature.  I spent time looking at and thinking about Monet’s Lily Pond and Garden; however, I formulated my own way of modulating the arrangements and the feelings of being surrounded by flowers. Mine is closer to the spectacular imagery in The Sound Of Music than any actual garden scene, such as Monet painted from. From a day trip to Geneva, not only seeing the arch bridge in his painting, a thing I found most impressive about him was his flower garden directly in front of the house, planted row by row and color by color.  The soul of impressionism is using color to create light.  He studied every day by looking these real flowers. Very smart fellow.
Comparing to the Series 1, I was releasing spontaneities energy in lines and intensify the spring color to summer. 

Brooklyn Botanical Garden Series 2
Oil On Linen 2012
94"x55'

name: No. 25-Prime Cherry Blossoms
description:
I told a friend that I got stock on these cherry blossoms in mid April during the morning coffee. She said," Oh! There are four trees budding up like crazy on some corner of Burgen street. You should go see."  I did. I walked slowly with very little hope, because I have seen many cherry blossom in many places.  Then I saw these four normal pink blossoms.  They were as vibrant as the ones in Central Park, but lack of tree pose gestures.  The tree trunks were straight up and lined with one another.  All of sudden, I thought about one very young brush painting instructor once said to me," Don't ever paint what you see!"  
I thank my friend who brought to the trees on Burgen.  That was exactly what I could not paint from.  I was drowning in all that lush pink. I got to come out of it.  In a short period afterwards, I finished these three imaginary blossoms on canvas.

We all want to be free but it comes on its own. I have finally found the fluidity and freedom in these intense cherry blossom. 

Blossom No. 25-Variations on Prime Cherry Blossoms
Oil On Linen 55”x30”, 2013
